code: @Manual{,   title = {simpleTaxonomy: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy},   author = {Stefan Lanz},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://stibu81.github.io/simpleTaxonomy/}, }

title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: simpleTaxonomy offers simple tools create interactive visualisations taxonomic hierarchies, specified csv-file simple structure.

title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: can install development version simpleTaxonomy GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("stibu81/simpleTaxonomy")

title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: package includes example file taxa order Carnivora. file German. can read visualised follows:  Nodes can opened closed clicking . hovering node, tooltip opens additional information possibly image. See working interactive example complete taxonomy.
code: library(simpleTaxonomy)  taxonomy_file <- get_example_taxonomy_file() taxonomy <- read_taxonomy(taxonomy_file) plot_taxonomy(taxonomy, show = "Rotfuchs")

title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: can get path example file included package first lines file: line defines taxon five columns: parent: common name parent current taxon. must exactly one row column empty, root tree. example file, first row. name: common name taxon defined row. scientific: scientific name taxon. rank: rank taxon. image_url: URL image current taxon. column optional image URLs can filled automatically Wikipedia. order rows irrelevant. tree valid, must exactly one root taxon, parent. addition, taxa used parents must also defined row. common names taxa (column name) well scientific names (column scientific) must unique. Currently, German ranks supported. can obtain list supported ranks follows: Ranks contained list may used, coloured visualisation. Sometimes, several taxa common name. example family Equidae genus Equus, German called “Pferde” (horses). taxa can distinguished adding identifier parenthesis. , name family genus “Pferde (F)” “Pferde”, respectively, make unique. identifier used distinguish two taxa building structure tree, shown visualisation.
code: get_example_taxonomy_file() #> [1] ".../library/simpleTaxonomy/example/carnivora.csv" parent,name,scientific,rank,image_url ,Raubtiere,Carnivora,Ordnung,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Stud_327_with_Blesbuck.jpg/100px-Stud_327_with_Blesbuck.jpg Raubtiere,Hundeartige,Caniformia,Unterordnung,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/Canis_mesomelas_vs._Arctocephalus_pusillus.jpg/100px-Canis_mesomelas_vs._Arctocephalus_pusillus.jpg Hundeartige,Hunde,Canidae,Familie,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/NIEdot306.jpg/100px-NIEdot306.jpg Hunde,Echte Füchse,Vulpini,Tribus,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d0/Vulpes_vulpes_standing_in_snow.jpg/100px-Vulpes_vulpes_standing_in_snow.jpg Echte Füchse,Vulpes,Vulpes,Gattung,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Vulpes_vulpes_laying_in_snow.jpg/100px-Vulpes_vulpes_laying_in_snow.jpg Vulpes,Polarfuchs,Vulpes lagopus,Art,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cb/Alopex_lagopus_qtl1.jpg/100px-Alopex_lagopus_qtl1.jpg Vulpes,Rotfuchs,Vulpes vulpes,Art,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Vulpes_vulpes_1_%28Martin_Mecnarowski%29.jpg/100px-Vulpes_vulpes_1_%28Martin_Mecnarowski%29.jpg Vulpes,Wüstenfuchs,Vulpes zerda,Art,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9f/Fennec_Fox_Vulpes_zerda.jpg/100px-Fennec_Fox_Vulpes_zerda.jpg Echte Füchse,Marderhund,Nyctereutes procyonoides,Art,https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/%D0%95%D0%BD%D0%BE%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%B4%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D0%BE%D0%B1%D0%B0%D0%BA%D0%B0_%D0%93%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%BD%D0%BE_%28cropped_2%29.jpg/100px-%D0%95%D0%BD%D0%BE%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%B4%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D0%BE%D0%B1%D0%B0%D0%BA%D0%B0_%D0%93%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%BD%D0%BE_%28cropped_2%29.jpg available_ranks() #> # title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: input data can read using function read_taxonomy(). following snippet reads example file package, can read file way. resulting object taxonomy_graph basically igraph object. Printing object shows summary properties:
code: taxonomy_file <- get_example_taxonomy_file() taxonomy <- read_taxonomy(taxonomy_file) class(taxonomy) #> [1] "taxonomy_graph" "igraph" taxonomy #> taxonomy_graph with 96 nodes. #> root node: Raubtiere  #> tree depth: 6  #> number of leaves: 63  #> graph has image url for 95 nodes. #>  #> most common ranks: #>  rank         n  #>  Art          57 #>  Familie      14 #>  Gattung      13 #>  Unterart      3 #>  Unterordnung  2 #>  Unterfamilie  2 #>  Tribus        2

title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: function enrich_taxonomy_with_images() can used add image URLs Wikipedia. uses Wikipedia API obtain URLs thumbnails associated Wikipedia pages corresponding common name , found, scientific name. function must called path input file, taxonomy_graph, writes image URLs back file. function prints short summary inform user many images found returns taxonomy_graph image URLs. Taxa, image found, marked “not_found” column image_url.
code: taxonomy <- enrich_taxonomy_with_images(taxonomy_file) #> try to get images for 23 taxa. #> found:  21 #> failed:  2

title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: taxonomy graph can visualised using plot_taxonomy(). default, root node expanded, function offers several arguments expand nodes. following example uses show expand tree taxa “Grosser Panda” “Löwe”. addition, full_expand used show taxa “Hunde”. Note full_expand expand nodes “Hunde”, case, “Hunde” visible expansion “Grosser Panda”. argument highlight used highlight taxa red.
code: plot_taxonomy(taxonomy,               show = c("Grosser Panda", "Löwe"),               full_expand = "Hunde",               highlight = c("Brillenbär", "Hyänen"))

title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: growing taxonomic hierarchy German can found GitHub. file can read directly GitHub follows: visualisation current state taxonomic hierarchy also available .
code: url <- paste0("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/",               "stibu81/taxonomyData/refs/heads/main/taxonomy.csv") taxonomy <- read_taxonomy(url)

title: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy
text: simpleTaxonomy comes Shiny app allows interact taxonomic hierarchy. can run default use taxonomic hierarchy described previous section. can also run file passing path file first argument. run app example data contained package:
code: run_taxonomy() run_taxonomy(get_example_taxonomy_file())

text: tibble

title: Count the Number of Taxa per Rank — count_ranks
text: by_rank used, number taxa counted complete graph subgraph specified subgraph. by_rank can used count ranks grouped taxa given rank. case, row correspond taxon requested rank column correspond rank.

title: Count the Number of Taxa per Rank — count_ranks
code: file <- get_example_taxonomy_file() taxonomy <- read_taxonomy(file)  # count the complete graph count_ranks(taxonomy) #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    rank             n #>    <ord>        <int> #>  1 Ordnung          1 #>  2 Unterordnung     2 #>  3 Überfamilie      1 #>  4 Familie         14 #>  5 Unterfamilie     2 #>  6 Tribus           2 #>  7 Gattung         13 #>  8 Art             57 #>  9 Unterart         3 #> 10 ohne Rang        1  # count only the cats count_ranks(taxonomy, subgraph = "Katzen") #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   rank             n #>   <ord>        <int> #> 1 Familie          1 #> 2 Unterfamilie     2 #> 3 Gattung          3 #> 4 Art             12  # count caniformia by family count_ranks(taxonomy, "Hundeartige", by_rank = "Familie") #> # A tibble: 9 × 5 #>   Familie     Tribus Gattung   Art Unterart #>   <chr>        <int>   <int> <int>    <int> #> 1 Hunde            2       2     8        0 #> 2 Bären            0       1     8        3 #> 3 Walrosse         0       0     1        0 #> 4 Hundsrobben      0       0     4        0 #> 5 Ohrenrobben      0       1     3        0 #> 6 Marder           0       3    10        0 #> 7 Skunks           0       0     1        0 #> 8 Ailuridae        0       1     0        0 #> 9 Kleinbären       0       1     1        0

title: Find Taxa By Pattern — find_taxon
text: Find taxa pattern return common names. output can passed arguments show, full_expand focus plot_taxonomy().

title: Find Taxa By Pattern — find_taxon
code: find_taxon(graph, pattern, target = c("all", "name", "scientific"))

title: Find Taxa By Pattern — find_taxon
text: graph taxonomy_graph object, typically created read_taxonomy(). pattern regex pattern, matching case insensitive. target character giving column search ("name" "scientific"). default "" searches columns. efficient exact matching, use get_taxon_names().

title: Find Taxa By Pattern — find_taxon
text: character vector giving taxon names match pattern

title: Find Taxa By Pattern — find_taxon
code: file <- get_example_taxonomy_file() taxonomy <- read_taxonomy(file) find_taxon(taxonomy, "katze") #>  [1] "Katzenartige"            "Katzen"                  #>  [3] "Kleinkatzen"             "Echte Katzen"            #>  [5] "Europäische Wildkatze"   "Hauskatze"               #>  [7] "Pardelkatzen"            "Grosskatzen"             #>  [9] "Eigentliche Grosskatzen" "Schleichkatzen"          #> [11] "Afrikanische Zibetkatze" "Ginsterkatzen"           find_taxon(taxonomy, "felis") #> [1] "Echte Katzen"          "Europäische Wildkatze" "Hauskatze"             #> [4] "Nebelparder"

title: Download URL for Wikipedia Images — get_wikipedia_image_urls
text: taxa character taxa image URL obtained. size integer giving width image pixel. lang language Wikipedia page use. Available languages include "de" (German, default), "en" (English), "fr" (French), "es" (Spanish). See List Wikipedias full list available languages. progress Whether show progress bar.

title: Download URL for Wikipedia Images — get_wikipedia_image_urls
text: character vector URLs. taxa thumbnail found, function returns NA.

title: Plot a Taxonomic Hierarchy — plot_taxonomy
text: Create interactive visualisation taxonomic hierarchy.

title: Plot a Taxonomic Hierarchy — plot_taxonomy
code: plot_taxonomy(   graph,   show = c(),   expand_rank = c(),   full_expand = c(),   focus = c(),   highlight = c(),   show_images = FALSE,   image_size = 150,   link_length = 150,   font_size = 12 )

title: Plot a Taxonomic Hierarchy — plot_taxonomy
text: graph taxonomy_graph object, typically created read_taxonomy(). show character giving common scientific names taxa visible. tree shown uncollapsed taxa. expand_rank character giving names ranks always expanded. full_expand character giving common scientific names taxa fully expanded, .e., taxa given taxon visible. Note expand graph given taxa, expanded part may invisible. Use show expand graph given taxon. focus character giving one several taxa focus . means tree taxon expanded well full subtree taxon. equivalent putting taxa show full_expand. focus used, two arguments ignored. highlight character giving common scientific names taxa highlighted. show_images images shown tooltips. requires image URLs contained taxonomy_graph. URLs Wikipedia can automatically added using enrich_taxonomy_with_images(). image_size integer giving width images pixels. link_length length horizontal links connect nodes pixels. font_size font size labels pixels.

title: Plot a Taxonomic Hierarchy — plot_taxonomy
text: collapsibleTree htmlwidget interactive tree visualisation.

title: Plot a Taxonomic Hierarchy — plot_taxonomy
text: function makes use html widget defined package collapsibleTree function collapsibleTreeNetwork() package can produce plot input data. plot_taxonomy() less flexible function collapsibleTree also much faster.

what: Read Taxonomic Hierarchy From File — read_taxonomy
title: Read Taxonomic Hierarchy From File — read_taxonomy
text: Read csv file contains data defines taxonomic hierarchy return graph.

title: Read Taxonomic Hierarchy From File — read_taxonomy
code: read_taxonomy(file, delim = ",")

title: Read Taxonomic Hierarchy From File — read_taxonomy
text: file path csv file delim delimiter used file

title: Read Taxonomic Hierarchy From File — read_taxonomy
text: taxonomy_graph object inherits igraph

title: Read Taxonomic Hierarchy From File — read_taxonomy
text: file must contain column names first row. row defines taxon following attributes: parent name parent taxon. column must empty root taxon. name name taxon used label nodes, e.g., common name. names must unique. scientific scientific name taxon. rank rank taxon, e.g., "Familie", "Art", similar (German ranks supported far). used colour nodes. function checks file satisfies following conditions: required columns present. exactly one root taxon, taxon without parent. duplicated names. parent taxon defined row table. rank always defined. addition, function also warns unknown rank used. still lead graph can plotted, nodes unknown rank coloured. common names (column "name") taxa must unique, used create graph. Sometimes, taxa identical common names, e.g. family Equidae genus Equus called "Pferde" German. theses cases, one can use additional identifier parenthesis make names unique, e.g., "Pferde (F)" "Pferde" family genus, respectively. identifier "(F)" removed shown visualisation.

title: Read Taxonomic Hierarchy From File — read_taxonomy
code: file <- get_example_taxonomy_file() taxonomy <- read_taxonomy(file) class(taxonomy) #> [1] "taxonomy_graph" "igraph"         as_tibble(taxonomy) #> # A tibble: 96 × 5 #>    parent       name         scientific               rank         image_url     #>    <chr>        <chr>        <chr>                    <chr>        <chr>         #>  1 NA           Raubtiere    Carnivora                Ordnung      https://uplo… #>  2 Raubtiere    Hundeartige  Caniformia               Unterordnung https://uplo… #>  3 Hundeartige  Hunde        Canidae                  Familie      https://uplo… #>  4 Hunde        Echte Füchse Vulpini                  Tribus       https://uplo… #>  5 Echte Füchse Vulpes       Vulpes                   Gattung      https://uplo… #>  6 Vulpes       Polarfuchs   Vulpes lagopus           Art          https://uplo… #>  7 Vulpes       Rotfuchs     Vulpes vulpes            Art          https://uplo… #>  8 Vulpes       Wüstenfuchs  Vulpes zerda             Art          https://uplo… #>  9 Echte Füchse Marderhund   Nyctereutes procyonoides Art          https://uplo… #> 10 Hunde        Echte Hunde  Canini                   Tribus       https://uplo… #> # ℹ 86 more rows

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. dplyr as_tibble

title: Run simpleTaxonomy Shiny App — run_taxonomy
text: Run simple shiny app included simpleTaxonomy. app provides several features interact taxonomy_graph. taxonomy_graph can read file URL. default, app loads data https://github.com/stibu81/taxonomyData.

title: Run simpleTaxonomy Shiny App — run_taxonomy
code: run_taxonomy(   file = NULL,   expand_ranks = c("Gattung", "Art", "Unterart"),   image_size = 150,   link_length = 200,   launch_browser = NULL )

title: Run simpleTaxonomy Shiny App — run_taxonomy
text: file Path file containing taxonomy_graph. omitted, data https://github.com/stibu81/taxonomyData used. expand_ranks list ranks always expanded. can changed interactively app. image_size numeric giving default image width pixels used app. user can change interactively app. link_length numeric giving default length links pixels used app. user can change interactively app. launch_browser logical, TRUE, application opened system's default browser, FALSE, browser started. argument omitted, value according option shiny.launch.browser used, RStudio opens internal shiny viewer.

what: Save Taxonomic Hierarchy to HTML-File — save_taxonomy
title: Save Taxonomic Hierarchy to HTML-File — save_taxonomy
text: Save plot taxonomic hierarchy created plot_taxonomy() self-contained HTML-file.

title: Save Taxonomic Hierarchy to HTML-File — save_taxonomy
code: save_taxonomy(widget, file, background = "white", title = "simpleTaxonomy")

title: Save Taxonomic Hierarchy to HTML-File — save_taxonomy
text: widget widget created plot_taxonomy(). file full path file background character giving html background colour widget. Defaults white. title text use title saved page

title: simpleTaxonomy: Create Interactive Visualisation of Taxonomic Hierarchy — simpleTaxonomy-package
text: Create interactive visualisations taxonomy hierarchy specified csv file using simple format. visualisation uses javascript library D3.js via R package collapsibleTree.
